New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder marked its 14th-straight win of the season — a franchise record.
Key Match Events: Aaron Wiggins scored 19 points, including 15 in the fourth quarter, to lead the Thunder to a comeback victory.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander contributed 33 points, four rebounds, and seven assists.
The Thunder outscored the Knicks 37-19 in the fourth quarter to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Isaiah Hartenstein praised Aaron Wiggins' performance, highlighting the depth of the Thunder's roster.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed confidence in Jalen Williams' All-Star potential.
Others: The Thunder's upcoming games include matchups against the reigning champion Boston Celtics and the top-seeded Cleveland Cavaliers.
